@jimsmi6 wrote:

I would also suggest you rewrite the code, because it would save more space than having the playerlevel code outside, instead have it inside, and make an else if.

item.title: Dummy, hay bale, door XPs
item.dc:creator: @X_Fin_pker_X X Fin pker X
item.description:
@X_Fin_pker_X wrote:

Mrquarter:

Buddy…you didn’t put the hitting to add the XP.

Yehh, but, the door and hay bales msg appears but dummys not? thats the prob… :FF[br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2006, 09:39:13 AM[/size][hr]And u said no XPs added,

//DOORS if (playerLevel[2] <= 50) { //if strenght not more then 50 if (objectID == 1531) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3435) || (objectX == 3253 && objectY == 3431)) { addSkillXP(500, 2); startAnimation(390); sendMessage("You slam the Door,"); sendMessage("You get some Strenght XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[2] >= 50) { //if strenght not more then 50 if (objectID == 1531) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3435) || (objectX == 3253 && objectY == 3431)) { startAnimation(390); sendMessage("You slam the Door."); }}} //HAY BALES if (playerLevel[1] <= 50) { //if defense not more then 50 if (objectID == 299) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3432) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3431)) { addSkillXP(500, 1); startAnimation(893); sendMessage("You search the Hay Bales,"); sendMessage("You found some Defense XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[1] >= 50) { //if defense is more then 50 if (objectID == 299) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3432) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3431)) { startAnimation(893); sendMessage("You search the Hay Bales,"); sendMessage("You found nothing."); }}} //DUMMYS if (playerLevel[0] <= 50) { //if attack not more then 50 if (objectID == 823) { if ((objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3436) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3438)) { addSkillXP(500, 0); startAnimation(390); sendMessage("You hit the Dummy,"); sendMessage("You get some Attack XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[0] >= 50) { //if attack is more then 50 if (objectID == 823) { if ((objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3436) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3438)) { startAnimation(390); sendMessage("You hit the Dummy."); }}}
Now better?..[br][size=1]Posted on: 29-12-2006, 17:50:05[/size][hr][glow=red,2,300]BUMP[/glow]

No1 can help meh? ;o

Read full topic

item.title: Dummy, hay bale, door XPs
item.dc:creator: @X_Fin_pker_X X Fin pker X
item.description:
@X_Fin_pker_X wrote:

Heres code what i use:

//DOORS if (playerLevel[2] <= 50) { //if strenght not more then 50 if (objectID == 1531) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3435) || (objectX == 3253 && objectY == 3431)) { sendMessage("You try to close the Door,"); sendMessage("It won't close but you get some Strenght XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[2] >= 50) { //if strenght is more then 50 if (objectID == 1531) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3435) || (objectX == 3253 && objectY == 3431)) { sendMessage("You try to close the Door,"); sendMessage("It won't close."); }}} //HAY BALES if (playerLevel[1] <= 50) { //if defense not more then 50 if (objectID == 299) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3432) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3431)) { sendMessage("You search the Hay Bales,"); sendMessage("You found some Defense XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[1] >= 50) { //if defense is more then 50 if (objectID == 299) { if ((objectX == 3249 && objectY == 3432) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3431)) { sendMessage("You search the Hay Bales,"); sendMessage("You found nothing."); }}} //DUMMYS if (playerLevel[0] <= 50) { //if attack not more then 50 if (objectID == 823) { if ((objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3436) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3438)) { sendMessage("You hit the Dummy,"); sendMessage("You get some Attack XP."); }}} if (playerLevel[0] >= 50) { //if attack is more then 50 if (objectID == 823) { if ((objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3436) || (objectX == 3250 && objectY == 3438)) { sendMessage("You hit the Dummy."); }}}

Doors and hay bales works fine, but dummys dont?[br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2006, 06:28:05 AM[/size][hr][glow=red,2,300]B U M P[/glow]

I realy need this. 0_0

[glow=yellow,2,300]EDITT:[/glow]
And dont display any errors or sutmhg… or connection lost… it just dont appear… ;o
